required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Free Iron and Out of Hospital Cardiac Arrest
clinical_study.official_title: Iron Metabolism After Out of Hospital Cardiac Arrest

brief_summary.textblock: Out of hospital cardiac arrest is associated with a poor prognosis. The aim of this study is to provide a better understanding of perturbations of iron metabolism after cardiac arrest and to analyze the impact on clinical centered outcome.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year

secondary_outcome.description: Cerebral Performance Categories scale, ranging from 1 to 5, with a patient considered "1" when he has good cerebral performance and 5 when he has very poor cerebral performance (including brain death)

study_pop.textblock: Patients admitted to ICU for out of hospital cardiac arrest

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient admitted to ICU for out of hospital cardiac arrest
- Therapeutic hypothermia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Absence of consent

patient_data.ipd_description: All collected data that underlie results in a publication
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will be available after the publication of result and ending three years maximum following the last visit of the last patient
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Data access requests will be reviewed by the international committee of Brest UH. Requestors will be required to sign and completet a data access agreement
